pages.text: Burning: the reaction between fire and wood will ignore the strength of wood elements. However, if the wood element is not robust, then on the basis of the flaming reaction, the entity catches fire and is damaged by the fire element. The reaction intensity affects the amount of damage caused by the fire element each time.
Explosion: in the melting reaction, if the fire element is robust, the ignition time of the entity is prolonged; if the metal element is robust, the explosion range and damage are increased.

Moisturizing: when cutting reaction occurs, if the entity is attached with water element at the same time, the entity consumes the corresponding amount of water element to prevent the increase of damage caused.

Boiling: when melting reaction occurs, if the entity is attached with water element at the same time, the melting reaction is replaced with a small-scale and continuous explosion, and the water element is attached in a small area.
Gliding: if the entity is attached with robust earth element and other elements exist, earth and corresponding elements will be consumed in each melee attack to attached to the specific element.
Mineralization: if the entity is attached with robust earth element and other robust elements exist, these two elements are consumed and an elemental crystal attached to these two elements is formed.
